Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2023e1.equipments.hem

Class HeaterConnector

java.lang.Object
fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractConnector
fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2023e1.equipments.hem.HeaterConnector
All Implemented Interfaces:
fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.ConnectorI, AdjustableCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
public class HeaterConnector extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractConnector implements AdjustableCI
The class HeaterConnector manually implements a connector bridging the gap between the given generic component interface SuspensionEquipmentControlCIand the actual component interface offered by the thermostated heater component (HeaterCI).

Description

The code given here illustrates how a connector can be used to implement a required interface given some offered interface that is different. The objective is to be able to automatically generate such a connector at run-time from an XML descriptor of the required adjustments.

White-box Invariant

 invariant      currentMode >= 0 && currentMode <= MAX_MODE

Black-box Invariant

 invariant      true        // TODO // no more invariant

Created on : 2023-09-19

Author:
Jacques Malenfant
